name: Aqua Waikiki Wave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually stay at the Resort Quest Waikiki Beach Hotel but the room rates went up to $200 a night minimum. I found the Aqua Wave Hotel on Trip Advisor and ended up booking the room right on the Aqua website because they were the only ones who had the "Partial Ocean View" option. I used the corporate rate (just showed my business card upon arrival) and got an "Partial Ocean View" room which was on the top floor (15th) half facing the ocean and half facing diamond head for only $108 a night! I was very happy with my stay. I picked the Wave property over the other Aqua resorts because of the new modern decor. Room had an LCD TV and new style linens and decorations. I liked that the hotel was located in the International Market Place and accross from Dukes which is one of my favorite beach hang out spots. Negatives about the stay were that the business center charged for internet access (even to just print boarding pass), lighting in bathroom was very dim, and the TV was very small (if I had to guess I'd say 25"). The room was very clean, bathroom was a nice size, large closet space, and all basic amenities were included (even toothbrush, saving cream, rasor) free of charge. For the price I paid, it was well worth it.
reviews.title: Best Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without a doubt the best stay ive ever had..please read the below letter i sent to the aqua waikiki wave.
reviews.title: The Bext Vacation Ever

likes.disliked: — nothing...there is no pool but who wants to hang out at a pool when you are i block from the best beaches in america!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To the staff of Aqua Waikiki Wave Resort.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

likes.disliked: — No schedules available for The Bus!

reviews.title: Friendly staff
reviews.text: I would like to tell you what a wonderful stay we had at your hotel. We checked in
February 27th and checked out March 4th 2008. From the moment we walked in the door till the time the bellman loaded our bags on Robert's shuttle bond for the airport
reviews.title: Great service, good location

reviews.text: I hope to answer many of the questions I had about the Waikiki Wave before arriving.
reviews.title: Great location/staff but a little noisy

likes.liked: — location, staff, comfortable and large rooms, dual lanais

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PARKING - The driveway entrance to the parking garage is on Kuhio after you pass the entrance to the hotel on the right. It's down a long driveway (on the left side is the lift garage which can be used for overflow if the garage is full) around the back. The garage has about 40 spaces and you can park in any open numbered spot. An earlier post said you can only park on one side - that is wrong. Once full, you can use the lift garage next door which I had to on Saturday night if you show your parking pass. Parking is plentiful during the day, but if you come back any time after 6pm, it is unlikely you will find a spot. Garage is pretty tight if you have a large car. $18 per day.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Excellent Value!

reviews.text: LOCATION - Center of Waikiki right next to the International Marketplace and you can walk right into the shopping centers from either side. You can find a cheap $3.50 bacon/pancakes breakfast a couple doors down at the Town Center on Kuhio which is good and fast. ABC Store a few doors down and fast food restaurants across the street. Walking distance to almost everything you need. Beach access is a couple blocks and easy to walk.
reviews.title: Just as fabulous the second time around!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HOTEL - Staff and management are super friendly and helpful. Among the best at any hotel. They will loan towels to take to the pool or the beach. We got upgraded to a 12th floor Aloha Deluxe Suite with 3 queen beds and 2 lanai facing the ocean/mountains and there was a complimentary basket of water, snacks, and chocolate waiting in the room courtesy of Lynette. Did not use the pool (which is very small and inconvenient) or the attached restaurants. There is a continental breakfast we were entitled to that we did not use and don't know where it is located. Beds comfortable and room spacious. Bathrooms are a little cramped. Front doors locked at night. Neighborhood felt safe at all hours.
reviews.title: fabulus hotel

likes.liked: — comfort of the room, location, kindness of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NOISE - There are two negatives to this hotel. One can be improved by the hotel, and one is out of their control. This hotel is noisy. Like the other posts said, they provide earplugs (one set is in the room already, and you can request more). The one problem that can be improved is the room doors. They slam. Loud. Every time someone closes a door, the walls rattle and you can feel a door slam clear on the other end of the hall. I understand its an older building, but even letting the doors close on their own (just the last few inches or so) will slam the door. We stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village after leaving this hotel and sometimes I had to turn around and make sure their doors were closed because they self-closed so quietly. The other cause of the noise which is just a symptom of their location is the neighborhood noise. You have Kuhio on one side (which is a fairly busy street), the International Marketplace on the other side (which has a Hawaiian band playing nightly about 100 feet away), and alleys on the two sides (one of which is a lift garage). The music stopped early enough but the alley traffic was loud, especially with noisy and beeping trash trucks every morning taking multiple loads. We stayed on the 12th floor and the trash pickup was still quite noticeable.
reviews.title: Loved the Wave

reviews.text: Aqua Wave was great!!
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel
Great Deal and Location
reviews.text: Check in was easy and fast, staff were great!
Our room was great, two queen size beds, very comfy!
reviews.title: Noisy 6th floor

reviews.text: Our room was clean and tidy and exactly like the pictures on the internet.
reviews.title: Good value, nice people

likes.liked: — At last an afordable hotel in Waikiki that was nice
likes.disliked: — Better if they didn't have pool.

reviews.text: Housekeeping were great, whenever we requested extra towels they were brought up within 5-10 minutes!
reviews.title: great staff

likes.liked: — friendly staff - Flora, Alma and Marilyn
likes.disliked: — porter did not help us with luggage when we left

reviews.text: I stayed at the AQUA Waikiki Wave February 7 - 14, 2007 for the ProBowl game. The newly renovated hotel was just what I needed for my trip. Rooms were clean and modern. I had a mini-fridge, micro, coffee maker, flat screen, safe as just some of the amenities.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the location of the hotel as it was centrally located to all my needs. The hotel is located near the International Market and just a block off the beach. Adjacent to the hotel is a great restaurant for a sit down meal (Big Kuhunas), Starbucks, Jamba Juice, Jack in the Box, and an ABC store (for all needs).
reviews.title: Service was great

reviews.text: The staff was great. Very friendly and quick to make any of your needs happen!
reviews.title: Decent Hotel, Good Location, Good price

likes.liked: — price and location for a short stay
likes.disliked: — Difficulty in accessing the lobby with your luggage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had to pull a few negatives out it would be the water in my bath most of the time was not hot. Eventually, it would get hot but I couldnt count on just jumping in the shower when I wanted. If you want a pool to swim in - this hotel does not have the pool for you. Bad location (enter through the garage) and very, very small. Hit the beach instead as it is only 5 minutes away.
reviews.title: Relaxing & Refreshing environment with Cozy & Classy ROOMS!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: I had a great vacation and when I come back, I will stay at this hotel again!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!! Fabulous!!!!

likes.disliked: — the pool. should have a nice pool for such a nice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I can say about this hotel was it was inexpensive. The hotel staff were rude. There is a pool in the parking lot that is so small an unappealing you would not want to use it. The staff said breakfast was not included even though trip advisor said it was. The location was okay but the lobby is in terrible condition. The room was just okay - the bathroom lighting was awful and you could hardly see yourself. Would never stay there again!
reviews.title: How can this hotel be rated so highly??????

reviews.text: Nice rooms, not particularly helpful or knowledgeable staff, and the worst breakfast I have had included in the price of a room. This is not just my gripe but was also shared by numerous other guests staying at the hotel.
reviews.title: Worst breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our honeymoon in Hawaii was great and we stayed in Aqua Waikiki Wave when we were in Oahu. The reviews say it is best value for money and it definitely is. The hotel was good, located pretty close to the beach and a lot of shops and restaurants around. The staff were very helpful esp Tasi, George and Susan. It was a very memorable stay for us because the 2nd day of our stay happened to be my husband's birthday. I spoke with Tasi to make arrangements for the birthday party and she coordinated very well. George did a great job decorating the room when we were out which was a great surprise for my husband. They made our stay happy and pleasant.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So this is the 2nd Aqua hotel we have stayed at in Honolulu, and just like the other hotel, it's exactly what you pay for. We paid $119 for a Partial Ocean view (and I mean Partial) but for that price I really can't complain. Fairly clean room decent ammenities, and centerally located. All in all it works. It's not luxury and it's not special........it just works. For a moderatly priced hotel in paradise, this is a great choice.
reviews.title: Good Price for a Good Hotel

likes.liked: — Good view once out on the balcony

reviews.title: Good Hotel Close to Everything
reviews.text: The Waikiki Wave is close to everything you need. The room was large and clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was friendly and even took off my parking garage fee since i returned my rental car the 2nd day! The only cons are small, the elevator usually took awhile to come and at times the 1 desk clerk got behind w/multiple check ins/outs. Overall i had an enjoyable stay and would stay at the Aqua Waikiki Wave again.

reviews.title: Not bad for the price
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The location is excellent. It is in the middle of Waikiki, right next to the International market. It is two blocks from the beach. The room was clean (703). You could tell that the hotel was recently renovated. There was new paint, artwork, flooring. We checked out towels from the front desk daily to go to the beach. There is a complementary coffee machine (regular and decaf) in the lobby. The decaf usually didn't work. 7-11 and a bakery are next door with Jack in the Box being across the street. Our balcony faced west, so we were able to sunbathe in the afternoon. The website said something about going away cookies, but the staff weren't aware of this. Location is safe. Would stay there again. 3 people for $114/night. Beds and pillows were comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With only 3 nights and 4 days to enjoy Oahu, we didn't want to spend too much money, so we took a chance on a less than 5 star hotel. We were not disappointed! No scenic views, but we expected that. We still enjoyed the balcony. The room was decorated very fashionably. The bed was clean, comfy and double-sheeted w/o an unsanitary comfortor or bed spread. Bathroom was nice and clean, w/a hairdryer. We enjoyed coffee in the room daily (absolute necessity) and purchased add'l ground coffee from the ABC store next door. Maid service was terrific. We easily obtained beach towels from the desk. We obtained useful info from the staff at the desk. The hotel is close to the beach and we took a $2 /ea. bus ride to Diamond Head. The only minor problem was really loud noises coming from the parking garage outside our balcony at 3am on Sunday. We should have called the desk, as they assured us that they would have called security and stopped whatever was going on. We rode it out with pillows over our heads and did get back to sleep! Our mistake! Sun. and Mon. nights were very peaceful. We would return to this hotel....especially for the deal we got through Pleasant Holidays. Debbie, Madera, CA
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — Clean and attractive. Car rental within walking distance.
likes.disliked: — Noisy parking garage next door on the weekend

reviews.text: I had read a few reviews about The Aqua Waikiki Wave complaining about the noise, the elevators, & the bathrooms. Well, you know what? Those people were correct but honestly, I got over all of that pretty quick. The hotel and its staff are WONDERFUL!!!!! My friend and I just got back on 3/14 and our stay was great! The hotel was a little difficult to find but we were looking for it at night. The outside is very non-discreet and could use some re-furbishments. The inside could use some work as well. However, the rooms are all done very nicely, very modern. My friend and I lucked out. We were given a corner room that was probably 1 1/2-2 times the size of a normal room. The bath room was quite small and needed some work but everything functioned. The elevators were alright. I've stayed at hotels where the elevators were MUCH slower. Unfortunately, one of the two elevators broke down while we were there and it was possibly at the worst time: the weekend. But it did get fixed come Monday and everything seemed fine. It could have been better if the pool were accessible from the hotel, instead of having to walk outside and around the hotel to get to the pool. But the beach is 2 blocks away. Why go to the pool? The hotel is, literally, right next to the International Market Place. Walk out the lobby doors, make 2 lefts. and you are at one end of the Marketplace. The staff were very friendly and eager to help give directions or whatever. The parking was a little difficult to find at first and it was first come, first serve in the hotel's parking garage. However, you could also park next door at the other garage so we never had issues with parking. Our room was on the 4th floor, facing Kuhio Ave so we got some of the noise at night. It seemed to bother my friend a bit but I slept through most of it. All in all, the hotel was great and I would definitely stay at the Aqua Waikiki Wave again.
reviews.title: Great Place 4 a Great Price!
great hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at this little hotel for the last 20 years. It was a great change with their remodel and the hotel staff is always very helpful and friendly. We plan to visit there again soon. The upgrade of the hotel has been wonderful and we hope more people will give this very nice and convenient hotel to the beach and the International Market Place a try.
Dick & Jan Reiter
reviews.title: Great value, and no compromises on cleanliness and modern feel.

reviews.text: This was the 2nd time I had stayed in this Hotel. I loved it. The staff were amazing. Very friendly and nothing was a bother (so rare these days) The hotel is located in the middle of Waikiki so it was easy to get around. Will definately be returning in the near future.
reviews.title: Loved the Place

reviews.text: Our family of four, including our 19 and 22 year old children, stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Wave Hotel in mid June. After an incredibly long flight from the Midwest, and the loss of one piece of luggage at the airport, we were greeted by George at the Aqua Wave front desk. George understood our frustrating day and offered to upgrade us to a room on the 12th floor. Our room was wonderful. It was located on the corner of the building with a great vew of the ocean from one lanai and the mountains from the other lanai. We booked a junior suite with 3 queen beds, which worked out very well for our family. It was very spacious, clean, and well appointed, including a flat screen TV! The staff couldn't have been more accommodating. They were very helpful, friendly and efficient in any of the requests we made or questions we had. George even gave us extra cookies to go with the coffee we made in our room! It was a short, pleasant walk to the beach passing many great stores; Coach, Louis Viton . . . I would reccommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Great rooms at a great price, and friendly staff.

reviews.text: After reading some reviews, I feel compelled to write and tell what a wonderful hotel this is. Our family travelled to Waikiki with another family in April of 2008. We have been to Hawaii several times and absolutely love it.
reviews.title: LOVED LOVED LOVED the Aqua Waikiki Wave - Hotel, Location, Staff

reviews.text: When we arrived and throughout our stay we were greeted by very friendly and helpful Bell Men (Darryl and James - totally awesome) and Front Desk Staff (George and especially Josh, who we LOVE). The hotel has recently been competely renovated and the rooms are very large and nicely decorated. People who complain about the small TV need to ask themselves why they are going to Hawaii to watch television.
reviews.title: Great value, awesome location.

reviews.text: The cleaning staff are very courteaus and although there were a couple days they were running late getting our rooms clean, they were always available to provide clean towels when needed. Not too concerned about my bed being made when I don't always get it done at home.
reviews.title: It made our vacation!

likes.liked: — I loved the room. The room was amazingly comfortable and the hotel was in the center of everything.
likes.disliked: — It did not offer a gratis business center and I found the $2/cup coffee machine in the lobby tacky. The coffee should have been free.

reviews.title: Great Hotel- Great Service- Very Friendly and Accommodating Staff
reviews.text: The experience from booking, to check-in to check-out was wonderful. Tulinh Luciano-DeSmith- sales director- gave me tons of information about the Aqua hotels to choose from and recommended the Wave after I provided my preferences over the phone. She was right on target with her recommendation. The room was spacious, beds were so comfortable with soft sheets! The views on both balconies were relaxing and you could see the ocean and the mountains in plain view. Precilla and George at the front desk were very helpful and friendly and my check-in was effortless and fast. As a frequent business traveler, I would place this hotel at the top of my list for value and quality. Great room, friendly service, and a perfect location!

From the moment we got to the Waikiki Wave we had a great experience. We arrived early off of a cruise and the bellman took our bags and assured us as soon as the room was ready he would bring them up for us! They upgraded our room because at the time they had the extra room and we had reserved 2 beds for the 3 adult ladies in our family. The best thing about the hotel was the the entire staff from the person who booked our excursions, the bellmen who helped us with our luggage and the memorable and fun front staff George and Kalei.
reviews.title: Great Staff!

likes.disliked: — The room was a little dark.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My mother lost a screw in her glasses, I asked if the maintence man had a screw driver so that I could try fixing them, he came up, made a make shift piece for the glasses and took the time to fix them!!! What great service!
reviews.title: We love the Aqua Waikiki and will go back soon!

likes.liked: — The excellent location, the staff service and atttitude, the overall feeling of luxury at a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Waikiki on a romantic vacation and stayed at the Aqua Waikiki for 10 nights. The whole place is magical and made us happy every minute of our stay! Starting with the hotel staff--George and Kalei at the front desk, the chambermaids, and the belhops--everyone was polite, cheerful, and very helpful. We felt pampered and well taken care of. Our room was on the 14th fl., overlooking the Kuhio side of the International Marketplace, and we had an amazing view of the ocean, the beautiful buildings around us, and the streets down below with all the happy people walking, laughing, the cheerful lights, and beautiful palm trees. The room was spacious, well appointed, smelled very plesantly of clean linen (no strong fragrances), the beds (2 queens) were super comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and well supplied, and the balcony was nice to be out on. The free wireless Internet connection in the room worked perfectly--we had a laptop with us and used it with no problem. In addition, there's a Business Center in the lobby, where the computers and fax are accessible for a fee.
reviews.title: Thank you George and crew

likes.liked: — the friendly way that the staff went about their tasks

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: The hotel is well maintained and creates the impression of luxury with the spacious colorful lobby, the surf-themed paintings on the walls, and the colorful plants.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mahalo
reviews.title: Okay for the money
Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: Mrs. Rodgers

This newly renovated hotel is fabulous!! a block away from the beach, right at the international market place! Great rooms! Great staff that takes care of you!!! room rateswere good! was impressed!!!! if your going to waikiki i suggest this hotel!
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything that everyone else has said is right, except for the bad reviews! The staff are always helpful and friendly, smiling all the time. The hotel is right in the heart of Waikiki so everything is close by. We had a room on the 12th floor which was fresh and clean, and the microwave and fridge were well used during our 2 week stay. The bakery is right next door if you fancy a fresh danish for breakfast and you can get everything else that you need in the ABC store. The area is safe and you are well looked after. Well done Aqua! Great Job!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.liked: — The staff and free wirelees internet

reviews.text: we stayed two nights before we rented a condo on the north shore and then one night before flying home. The staff were great. Very friendly and helpful. Super bell hop and George at the front desk were tops.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — stairs from the street to the front lobby

reviews.text: We were travelling with another couple so we stayed in a mini-suite which was great for what we needed. There are 3 queen size beds. Two beds in a big room and one bed in a bedroom which has sliding doors to close of this room for privacy. Two balconies, two LCD TV's, fridge and everything you would want. Our one balcony faced the ocean and you could look right down on the International market. The hotel and room were clean and we had no problems. We would stay there again. They also had free wireless internet that worked.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked to first two nights through a website and payed a lot more than when we walked in off the street and booked the room the last night before leaving.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 1st week in February..very pleased...great accommodations if you are taking a family trip to Honolulu... nice beds, nice spacious rooms, modern... one of the nicest, friendliest staffs I have ever experienced in staying in hotels for over 40 years.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Location, and great people

likes.disliked: — Street noise from dumpster dumping in morning

reviews.text: I am a real estate agent in Canada. I really needed a break and at the same time, since I was in Honolulu for two weeks with my son, I was looking for a clean place, close to everything without having to rent a car.
reviews.title: Very good choice of hotel.

likes.liked: — The promimity to everything and It was also very clean.
likes.disliked: — I would have to say the pool. So small, mine is bigger at home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 14 nights at the Waikiki Wave Hotel and let me tell you, what a nice vacation we had!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel bargain in Waikiki

reviews.text: The hotel is close to everything. Beach, restaurants, marketplace, bus stop, name it !!
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Location, Spotless

likes.liked: — Size and cleanliness of the room

reviews.text: Our room was on the 12th floor. Beautiful view, very clean room, beds were also very very comfortable, we had everything we expected. We appreciated the check-in which only took a few minutes especially after a tweve hour flight. All employees were also very kind and helpful. We really felt at home.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I'm planning on going back again next summer. Waikiki is also a very clean city. Ohahu Island is worth to be seen! There are lots of things to do. Submarine tours, boat tours, surfing lessons, luaus, hula lessons, cayaking at Kaiula bay (beautiful), snorkeling at Hanauma Bay, shopping, etc..
reviews.title: Great Bargin!!
lovely place
reviews.text: We stayed here March 4th 2007 for one night at $114 and were very satisfied. The rest of our trip we were staying at a $300 a night hotel, so we chose to stay our first night in an inexpensive hotel to save some money. The room was clean and recently renovated. I didn't feel like I was staying in an old and dingy room (which was what I expected for the price). I have stayed at hotels in Hawaii for this price, but it usually feels dated or worn. Not the Aqua Waikiki Wave. Aqua Waikiki Wave felt modern and clean.

The water pressure in the shower was more than adequate, maid service was good, and we did not have to wait long for the elevators. The pool is not worth going to. But if you're just looking for a place to sleep, it doesn't really matter anyway. The continental breakfast is not worth it (mediocre coffee and Danish). But you can go across the street to Seaside Bar and Grill for a cheap breakfast.
reviews.title: Good Value!

likes.liked: — Comfortable and clean and great location

reviews.title: Great trip!
reviews.text: If you don't want to pay $18 a night to self park, there is Ameripark garage right next door (in the alley) for $10 a night. If you want to go in and out (in one day) of Ameripark, you pay a different rate. It is a mulit-level automatic garage with one or two attendants.

Myself, my wife and two kids (14 & 10) stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Wave for four nights from the 26th to the 30th of June, 2008. After reading dozens of reviews we chose the Aqua Waikiki Wave and booked a Junior Suite for $113 a night plus taxes direct from the hotel website. We checked it often and altered the booking as room prices fell. Our flight from Oz and trip from the airport got us to the hotel in the late morning. As check-in wasn’t until 3:00pm we had planned on leaving our bags and wandering around for the afternoon. After a quick lunch we returned to the hotel to pick up some beach towels only to find out our room was ready! A porter immediately brought up our luggage and we were in our room by 12:30pm.
reviews.title: If you're looking for an excellent mid-range hotel, you'll find it here!

reviews.text: We occupied room 1214, which is a corner room with two lanais. Diamond Head was visible from one side and surprisingly good view of the ocean from the other.
reviews.title: bed bugs infested hotel......
Great Place and Great Staff
reviews.text: The larger than average size room was exactly as per the website. The bathroom was on the small side, however no smaller than any other hotel I’ve stayed at in the last 10 years. The water pressure was excellent and the lighting, although initially dim, comes good after a couple of minutes. Both were well presented, smelling clean and fresh.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel backs onto the International Marketplace with Dukes Lane alongside. After reading other reviews we were nervous about the noise. Our stay included Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights, and on all but one of those the music and general noise had died down well before midnight. On the Saturday night, a band playing in a club nearby had their Marshalls cranked up to 11 and was really loud, even with the supplied ear plugs! There wouldn’t have been a hotel room in the area that would have been immune. They finished up at about 1:30am and I drifted back off to sleep. Saying that, of the four of us, I was the only one to have had trouble sleeping that night. Although we occasionally heard the garbage trucks at about 6:00am they did not bother us. The hotel itself was quiet and we never heard our neighbors even though the neighboring rooms were all occupied. Some people have complained of the bell from the elevator bothering them but our room was further down the hall. Beware of the slamming entry doors though as they don’t have soft closers and take a few times before you catch on.
reviews.title: A little sketchy, but good price!

reviews.text: The beds were by far the most comfortable I’ve slept on in any hotel and possibly more so than my own bed at home! The small LCD TV was in a rather strange location which made viewing awkward but I didn’t watch it anyway. The coffee maker/coffee, free room safe and daily newspapers were definite bonuses as well as the WiFi internet, which worked great. In most places you pay for those extras.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! good Deal!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel from March 1 to March 6 2007, but I must first start my review by pointing out that I think I actually had one of the best rooms in the hotel, it was a Junior Partial Ocean view room number 1505 on the top floor. This room was fantastic, it was huge, it had two balconies (Lanai's), one faced kuhio Ave side which was good, you could see all the activity on the streets below but were up high enough not to be bothered by the noise and the other balcony faced Diamond Head with partial ocean glimpses. The room appeared to have been recently renovated, it felt clean and comfortable, the bed was soft and comfortable, the other good thing they do with the beds is they place a clean sheet over the top of the bed as a bedspread, a great idea. The carpet was clean, the room had everything a flat screen TV, a fridge, good airconditioning, tea and coffee and a microwave. The hotel is centrally located in the middle of Waikiki, right next to the International Market Place and a 5 minute stroll to the main beach. If you do stay here I recommend spending a little extra and going for a higher floor, say 10 and up. Now for a couple of negatives, the Hotel has a pool but I wouldn't bother, Its right at the back of the Hotel you have to walk through the carpark to get to it and it's tiny, and if you are a family with young children and have strict morale views be aware that the hotel appeared to be right in the middle of the area for street walking protitutes at night. Everynight and in the mornings there were quite a number of obvious street walking protitutes, while I was waiting for the shuttle bus at 5am to take me back to the Airport to leave I was approached by at least 5 of them, they are not rude or anything but they are not shy. But on the whole I had a great stay, no problems with the staff, all were helpfull and polite.
reviews.title: Great Room and Location

likes.disliked: — The pool and the street prostitutes out front.

reviews.text: Was at the Wave several years ago when it was the Coral Reef and WOW!, what a change they have made! The whole place has been renovated to feel like a cool metropolitan hotel. The rooms have warm red walls, polished brass hardware, soft and cushy carpet, on and on! The one thing that has not changed are the views of Diamond Head and the Ocean from the higher floors (note to self)!
reviews.title: Loved it! Awesomliscious!!
Fantastic Service, Staff and Room
reviews.text: Not only did we love the new renovation but the location is great too. 2 blocks to the beach, 1 block to Tiffany's and Prada, and 3 Starbucks' within 3 blocks! I forgot to mention, free beach towels were given to us by the front desk when they saw we had our beach gear in tow!

Then there is the staff that is sooo great!! What service for such a good value hotel. The bellman and housekeepers remembered our names and everytime someone saw us, they asked "is there anything we can do to make your stay better?! Wow! Waikiki Wave, you have won our hearts!!
reviews.title: Decent hotel for the price

reviews.text: Sincerely, Mr. Ride Da Wave!
reviews.title: Great Refurbished Rooms and Friendly Staff!!!

likes.liked: — Quality of the room and proximity to everything in Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do not blame the hotel for our disappointment. In fact the staff was great and atleast attempted to help. We did the dumb thing and let a travel agent handle our honeymoon. She promised us a large room with balcony and nice view of either the city or ocean. We were told since we were honeymooning that we would get a free upgraded room.
reviews.title: Not what we expected

reviews.text: We ended up with a not so small room, but there were two queen sized beds. Maybe ok for a large family on a budget but not exactly to appealing for a honeymoon couple. The beautiful view from the balcony, was a dark parking garage. The bathroom was rather small, and the water pressure in the shower wasnt exactly great. I hate complaining but I figured since we're on a honeymoon, I'd atleast attempt to get a better room with only "one" bed. As I said the staff was nice, and he apologized but he informed us that they were unable to upgrade our room as promised by agent, unless of course we forked out more money. He did move us to another room. However again there were two beds, and even worse water pressure. The rooms were clean but rather dim and rustic looking due to decor and carpet. Our sheets were changed only the 2nd day of our stay. After a few days I asked a maid for fresh sheets and after she handed them to me, she mumbled to a co worker that a tip goes a long ways. I guess the $3 tip we left each morning wasnt enough to even get a change of sheets.The free breakfast consisted of a danish roll and a cup of coffee (No, Im not kidding) The location of the small pool creeped us out. But overall we were close to the beach and some good resturaunts. The noise wasnt as bad as it could have been. There was a nice tv in room and the beds were comfortable. And for the 3rd time, the staff was easy going and nice, but just couldnt do any of the things our travel agent promised us. Unless we were on a serious budget, I wouldnt stay there again. And if any of you are planning a honeymoon in Hawaii, stay elsewhere!!!
reviews.title: for under $100 you couldnt beat it

likes.disliked: — Sheets on the bed, disarray in foyer (remodelling) NO POOL

reviews.text: Gave great value for money. We booked a standard double/double room on the lower levels but on arrival seemed to be upgraded to a higher level room. We were apprehensive about the noise level as we had heard that Waikiki could be very noisy (especially at night), but on level 8 we were high enough to not notice it, even with the door open to the balcony.
reviews.title: Great value, friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all really friendly and willing to help with directions, luggage, etc.
reviews.title: My wife forgot to mention the hookers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor really impressed for the price - the hotel seemed to have been newly renovated at some recent stage so everything was nice, clean and comfortable. Best of all - the room appeared exactly the same as the pictures on the website!
reviews.title: Room was filthy and noisy! Yuck!
Moved to Waikiki Marriott After 3 Nights No Sleep
reviews.text: Location was also very good - a few blocks from the beach but if you take the short cut it ends up being less than 5 mins.
Only negative is late at night, there are dodgy people on the main street - but that's just Waikiki at night.
reviews.title: Perfect, thankyou Aqua Wave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Waikiki Wave for 8 nights, 8/28-9/5 2008 for our first visit to Hawaii. I made the selection due to the high rating on TripAdvisor as well as the central location. We arrived around 10pm after a 12+ hour flight from Florida via Atlanta...and check-in was quick. I had booked a Deluxe Room...and noticed that the day before we left that although the rate for the first 3 days of our stay had gone up, the last 5 days the cost had gone down...I emailed and asked if we could take advantage of the new rates, and got an immediate email response that canceled our first reservation and a new reservation made that saved us over $100 for the 8 nights. MUCH APPRECIATED!
reviews.title: Waikiki Wave - Great Location and Value

likes.liked: — Good size room, central location, and room category selected got us a great view

reviews.text: Although we came back many afternoons to find that our room had not been refreshed yet, having previously had part ownership in a Sleep Inn, I can understand the need to make over the rooms of those that check-out before doing the rooms of the continuing guests. Our room was on the 12th floor (1213) which allowed great views to the east -- and even the top most point of Diamond Head, a couple wide views of the Pacific to the south, and view of the north with great rainbows after the short afternoon rain over the mountain. The balcony overlooked the entertainment area of the International Market Place... which always ended by 10pm, so was not an interference at all for sleep.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: The Expedia staff at the Concierge staff were very helpful in making suggestions for tours, and we did a last minute choice to fly to the Big Island for the Volcano Night tour. We did not rent a car -- but walked almost everywhere due to the central location to Waikiki. We did get the 4-day Visitor Bus Pass for $20 and used it for such trips to Diamond Head and even to the North Shore to get one of the famous snow cones. We had gone past it on our Grand Island Tour a few days earlier ... and Honolulu has an amazing public bus transit system.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay
Big improvement
reviews.text: We usually ate breakfast in our room (did not opt for the continental breakfast plan) since we had a microwave and refrigerator. We found that most all the nicer eating places had lunch prices or early birds until 5 or 6pm. We saved a great deal by eating earlier. This included Cheesecake Factory, Atlantis, etc. The gift shop at the front entrance had deals as good as the International Market Place and Dukes Lane, and went in there about everyday to pick up shirts, hats, even snacks. The clerk was tireless there from open to close and very helpful. (The Food Pantry just a couple blocks away across the street to the east is a full grocery store, and a better option to the ABC Stores for food items - has deli areas as well.)

Aqua Resorts seem to have their "act" together and have done almost a phenomenal job at remodeling this older hotel (a few cracked tiles in the shower, but all plumbing worked fine). The bed was one of the most comfortable we have had in a hotel ... the decor was exactly like their website photos - no bait switch and tactics with the photos. The lobby was smaller than the larger hotels but more than adequate with a seating area, the concierge desks, and a few small shops, plus a couple restaurants, business center, etc. The free Wi-Fi seemed slow although I had a very good to excellent signal ... so opted for my Sprint Broadband Wireless modem most of the time. All the staff from the front desk to maintenance to housekeeping always greeted us with an "Aloha" and/or "Mahalo" which shows they really care about their guests.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel Aug 6-13th and had a great experience at Aqua Waikiki Wave. First time in HI, had no idea where to stay, since there are so many hotels in the city. The hotel is smaller than the usual high rises you see on the beach, BUT it's renovated, which makes for a big difference. We booked a partial view suite, highly recommend, we had two balconies, high floor and view of the beach, not up close but further away but still nice. Very clean place, our room was well taken care of, didn't have ANY problems or issues. Staff was very nice. Highly recommend, very close to the beach, to Internantional Market place, as well as all the shops. Loved the place. It's cheaper than the other hotels, so it was a great deal.
reviews.title: Aqua Wave was great

likes.liked: — The staff was extremely helpful and friendly
likes.disliked: — The bathroom was a bit small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was aware of the Hotel location prior to making the reservation. The hotel staff was great, location was great. I was on the 11th floor which had very little noise from below.
reviews.title: Very good price

description: Aqua Waikiki Wave is a contemporary boutique hotel featuring spacious rooms with a hip decor located 1 block to the beach and next to the International Marketplace in the heart of Waikiki. This hotel offers the following FREE amenities: WiFi Internet access in-room & throughout hotel, local & toll-free calls, AquaBLISS pillow top beds, refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker and safe. Additional amenities include a business center, activities desk, retail shops, convenience store and two restaurants.
